comments.body:
Do we no longer need to set up the Google Cloud SDK for docs?

https://github.com/flutter/flutter/blob/82415e640001fd2934cb1cc9ceed902cea4a2025/dev/bots/travis_setup.sh#L10
No, it turns out we haven't used Google Cloud for the API docs in a couple of years.  It's all Firebase now.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +69,73 @@  setup_android
fi

# Run flutter to download dependencies and precompile things, and to disable
# analytics on the bots.

comments.body: Is this used to improve Cirrus' logging? With this setup, will we still see the log of a running script when there's no error?

This is to reduce the huge amount of log output we are producing, but not reduce the output in the case where we need to diagnose a failure.

No, you won't see a log unless it fails.  Yeah, it would be better if we could see some progress, but the alternative is MBs of log output, which is more than useless.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +5,9 @@# It must be run from the root of the Flutter repo.

# Collects log output in a tmpfile, but only prints it if the command fails.
function log_on_fail() {
  local COMMAND="$@"

comments.body: Why can't this be done in Docker image? I understand that this step probably doesn't cost any significant time, so I'm just curious.

Because I'm not setting up Flutter itself in the Docker image. I can't do that (at least not in the same location), because the cloning of the repo will fail during builds then.

I suppose I could make the directory and touch the file to silence the warning, however.
I wonder if setup the Flutter in the Docker image would further accelerate the process. We can also update the image every day or every week to make the cache fresh so it will keep fast.

Yeah, that would be great, and I originally tried that, but the problem is that Cirrus always does a `git clone` to create the repo, and that will fail if the flutter directory already exists.

We could do some magic where we throw away the cloned directory and move in the one from the docker image, and then git pull into it to freshen it, but I think I'd save that for another PR.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +36,40 @@./bin/flutter doctor -v

# Accept licenses.
log_on_fail accept_android_licenses && echo "Android licenses accepted."
